subject: RE: [junit] unknows AssertError and feature request
msgSnippet: Hi, I have no experience with Junit 4.1 but I suppose that this did not change from 3.8:  There are overloaded assert methods which accept an additional string
messageBody:
Hi,



I have no experience with Junit 4.1 but I suppose that this did not
change from 3.8: There are overloaded assert methods which accept an
additional string that is supposed to add explanatory text to the assert
statement. In most cases I prefer this overloaded assert methods to the
basic ones because it helps me better understand failures.



Andreas



________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
Gott
Sent: Wednesday, September 13, 2006 4:07 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] unknows AssertError and feature request



Hello,

I'm new to JUnit. Before I testet my code with System.out.println(),
but in these days my code became more complex. I work with Eclipse-3.2
and JUnit-4.1.

First of all I have a problem with an error msg.
>>> java.lang.AssertError: expected: <1> but was: <2>
Now I known that belongs to the number of contructors. But it was a
very long way to get this solution. May it could be more infomational,
please.

Secound: I use parameters annotation for for loading different configs
for multiple test runs. But when the tests are run I only see a list
of the tested methode but no parameters or something like that.
In this case I only knows that there was an error in test No 25, e.g.,
but I don't known why. I can not see the current input of test No 25.

Is there a solution? How I can see more information in the conclusion
of the test runs?

thx.

Ciao, scherzartikel_gottes





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
